alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 12 at 1:59PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Utah and Wyoming, including the following areas, in Utah, Bryce Canyon Country, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, Castle Country, Central Mountains, Eastern Juab/Millard Counties, Lower Washington County, Sanpete Valley, Sevier Valley, South Central Utah, Southern Mountains, Southwest Utah, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs, Western Uinta Mountains and Zion National Park. In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in debris flows on area burn scars and flash flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, slickrock areas, streams, urban areas, and low-lying flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flash Flood Warnings. Those living and recreating in areas prone to flash flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
